citations.narrative:
Acquisition records (including where and when the animal was acquired) was missing for all the animals. Lack of
acquisition information doesn't allow for proper tracking by APHIS officials. All acquisition information must be
documented for all regulated animals. Correct by 11/10/24.

The licensee does not currently have a contingency plan in place. Not having a contingency plan doesn't ensure the
facility will be prepared in the event of an emergency or disaster. The licensee must complete the contingency plan in
accordance with the requirements outlined in the Animal Welfare Act. Correct by 11/10/24.

The fallow deer had access to two different shelters. Both shelters were in disrepair and had holes on the back walls. In
addition, the shelter for the two male fallow deer had a hole in the ceiling. Holes in the wall/ceiling will have jagged edges
that could cause injury to the animals. Also, as these holes in both buildings get larger, it will make it where it doesn't
adequately protect the deer from the elements of the weather. Both shelters need to be repaired and maintained
afterwards so it is structurally sound and protects the animals from injury and from the elements of the weather. Correct
by 11/10/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Acquisition records (including where and when the animal was acquired) was missing for all the animals. Lack of 
acquisition information doesn't allow for proper tracking by APHIS officials. All acquisition information must be 
documented for all regulated animals. Correct by 11/10/24. 
2.134 
   
Contingency planning. 
The licensee does not currently have a contingency plan in place. Not having a contingency plan doesn't ensure the 
facility will be prepared in the event of an emergency or disaster. The licensee must complete the contingency plan in 
accordance with the requirements outlined in the Animal Welfare Act. Correct by 11/10/24. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The fallow deer had access to two different shelters. Both shelters were in disrepair and had holes on the back walls. In 
addition, the shelter for the two male fallow deer had a hole in the ceiling. Holes in the wall/ceiling will have jagged edges 
that could cause injury to the animals. Also, as these holes in both buildings get larger, it will make it where it doesn't 
adequately protect the deer from the elements of the weather. Both shelters need to be repaired and maintained 
afterwards so it is structurally sound and protects the animals from injury and from the elements of the weather. Correct 
by 11/10/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
